strings.Value: "I'm ready to look around the city! Lead the way!"
"The main question is: where can I get a drink or three? It's time to toast my victory!"
"Are there any citizens I should know about?"
"What's the mood of the people here?"

"Welcome, Your Grace!" {n}Kesten salutes you. You can see he's a bit anxious, and it seems he'd rehearsed his speech many times.{/n} "Let me once again congratulate you on your victory, and your new title. Lady Jamandi transferred me here. I am at your disposal. I'm not one to bestow honors... but I want you to know: I'm glad to serve you."

"I'm here to welcome you on behalf of your new capital's citizens. The Stag Lord's former stronghold will soon be a thriving city. Word travels fast, and the first settlers have already arrived, with new ones approaching as we speak."

"While you were visiting {g|Restov}Restov{/g}, much has been done here. Your benefactors — the Aldori — invested a great deal of resources in rebuilding the city. I stand ready to answer your questions and to show you around the most important sites."

"While you were visiting {g|Restov}Restov{/g}, much has been done here. Your benefactors — the {g|House Surtova}Surtovas{/g} — invested a great deal of resources in rebuilding the city. I stand ready to answer your questions and to show you around the most important sites."

"While you were visiting {g|Restov}Restov{/g}, much has been done here. Your ally from {g|House Lebeda}House Lebeda{/g} invested a great deal of resources rebuilding the city. I stand ready to answer your questions and to show you around the most important sites."

{n}Kesten hesitates a brief moment, then laughs.{/n} "I'll make sure to show you, the moment we enter the city. The tavern was the first business that opened — building a city is thirsty work. And, erm, I beg your forgiveness for my behavior during your reception. I drank a little too much. It is a day for celebration!"
"They are all somewhere around here, but I never kept an eye on who went where exactly... Well, I assume Tristian is with Jhod, and you can always find Linzi — just follow the noise and turmoil."

"Our old acquaintance Jhod is right here. {g|Erastil}Erastil's{/g} clerics normally don't like cities much, but he's eager to serve you. Also, the emissary from {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g} is here, waiting for you in the throne room. There's also this curious matter: an elf has paid us a visit. A blind elf. {g|Desna}Desna{/g} only knows how he managed to get here. He seems a peaceful, even pleasant fellow, though naturally a little odd, so I let him stay a while. It's up to you to decide what to do with him now. That's about it, I guess..." {n}Kesten scratches his head.{/n}

"I must admit, I've never seen anything like that my whole life. A city — a whole barony, born right in front of our eyes. The people sense the moment, and today we're feeling proud. As a rule, I'm not too cheerful or chatty... I'd normally feel out of place among all the rejoicing, but today is just one of those days!"
"They scattered around, each finding their own place to stay. I guess Tristian is with Jhod somewhere."
